<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_read:
```c
int lfs_dir_read(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir, struct lfs_info *info) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_read(%p, %p, %p)",
            (void*)lfs, (void*)dir, (void*)info);

    err = lfs_dir_read_(lfs, dir, info);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_read -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_dir_read:
struct lfs_info {
    // Type of the file, either LFS_TYPE_REG or LFS_TYPE_DIR
    uint8_t type;

    // Size of the file, only valid for REG files. Limited to 32-bits.
    lfs_size_t size;

    // Name of the file stored as a null-terminated string. Limited to
    // LFS_NAME_MAX+1, which can be changed by redefining LFS_NAME_MAX to
    // reduce RAM. LFS_NAME_MAX is stored in superblock and must be
    // respected by other littlefs drivers.
    char name[LFS_NAME_MAX+1];
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
Fragments not listed do not declare or pass pointer types that could/should be const-qualified and therefore do not need investigation for Rule 8.13. Specifically:
- The LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg) and LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg) calls operate on lfs->cfg (locking mechanism) and do not introduce additional pointer-typed API that should be const-qualified here.
- The trace of the return value (LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_read -> %d", err)) and the local variable err are unrelated to pointer const-qualification.
- The struct lfs_info definition contains an internal char array (name) and scalar fields (type, size), not pointer members that would require const qualification.
These items therefore do not need further investigation for compliance with MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
